article.title: Boeing Supports Super Hornet and Growler for Several Countries
article.abstract: The Boeing Company is being awarded a $33,863,858 firm-fixed-price, cost-plus-fixed-fee task order against a previously awarded basic ordering agreement for integrated logistics support and sustaining engineering services in support of F/A-18 A-F and EA-18G aircraft for the U.S. Navy and the governments of Australia, Finland, Kuwait, Malaysia; Switzerland, Canada and Spain.
article.text: The Boeing Co., St. Louis, is being awarded a $33,863,858 firm-fixed-price, cost-plus-fixed-fee task order (0006) against a previously awarded basic ordering agreement (N00019-16-G-0001) for integrated logistics support and sustaining engineering services in support of F/A-18 A-F and EA-18G aircraft for the U.S. Navy and the governments of Australia, Finland, Kuwait, Malaysia; Switzerland, Canada and Spain. Services to be provided include engineering, provisioning, information systems, technical data updates, support equipment engineering, training and software integration support. Work will be performed in St. Louis (76 percent); El Segundo, California (15 percent); Bethpage, New York (5 percent); and San Diego (4 percent), and is expected to be completed in December 2016. Fiscal 2014 and 2016 aircraft procurement (Navy); fiscal 2016 operations and maintenance (Navy); and foreign military sales funds in the amount of $33,863,858 will be obligated at time of award, $20,938,046 of which will expire at the end of the fiscal year. This order combines purchases for the Navy ($29,013,260; 86 percent); and the governments of Australia ($2,190,403; 8 percent); Finland ($382,569; 1 percent); Kuwait ($382,569; 1 percent); Malaysia ($382,569; 1 percent); Switzerland ($382,568; 1 percent); Canada ($373,005; 1 percent); and Spain ($373,004; 1 percent) under the Foreign Military Sales program. The Naval Air Systems Command, Patuxent River, Maryland, is the contracting activity.

imgalttext.img: Boeing is being awarded a $33,863,858 task order for integrated logistics support and sustaining engineering services in support of F/A-18 A-F and EA-18G aircraft for the Navy and the governments of Australia, Finland, Kuwait, Malaysia, Switzerland, Canada and Spain.
